solution_line_template: First, we find their current point in time be realizing that {future_anniversary_years} years is {future_anniversary_years} sets of {months_per_year} months, meaning at that anniversary they will have been together {future_anniversary_years}*{months_per_year}=<<{future_anniversary_years}*{months_per_year}={months_at_future_anniversary}>>{months_at_future_anniversary} months

Then, we subtract their {months_until_future_anniversary} month difference, finding they are at {months_at_future_anniversary}-{months_until_future_anniversary}=<<{months_at_future_anniversary}-{months_until_future_anniversary}={current_months_together}>>{current_months_together} months into their relationship.

Since {past_anniversary_years} years would be {past_anniversary_years}*{months_per_year}=<<{past_anniversary_years}*{months_per_year}={months_at_past_anniversary}>>{months_at_past_anniversary} months into the relationship.

We take the larger number, {current_months_together}, and subtract the smaller number, {months_at_past_anniversary} to find the difference in months, meaning it is {current_months_together}-{months_at_past_anniversary}= <<{current_months_together}-{months_at_past_anniversary}={months_difference}>>{months_difference} months
